intro: Plectritis involuta, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a pearly appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Plectritis involuta is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
